name: welcome
body:
### I'm @almosteverywhere. 

## Currently available for new client engagements on a remote consulting basis. 

## I like working on data projects, seeing patterns in things and leveraging them for awesome. 

## Projects: 

Implemented a machine learning-based parser to automatically extract publication dates of news articles online. The parser is 90% accurate on any random news article, and is an implementation of this research paper: http://www.jofcis.com/publishedpapers/2010_6_1_279_285.pdf. I used python and nltk.

Implemented automated spambot detection on a django site with ~600k user profiles. I detected and deleted 25K spam accounts, and it automatically deletes most new incoming spambot accounts.

Implemented international, multi-language shipping on a django e-commerce site with 25 million/year revenue.

### I like to give talks. Here are some of my talks: 

[Pecha Kucha Tokyo 2015: "How Bangkok wakes up"](http://www.pechakucha.org/presentations/waking-up-in-bangkok)

[Strange Loop 2014 "Woman-haters gonna hate: analyzing rap lyrics using Python"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OYZEVDIKN8c)

[PyCon 2014 "Analyzing rap lyrics using Python" ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FQuIqtx1Z24)


[Montreal Python, "Hacker School", Montreal ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3W6yQ2dXJk8)

[Montreal Python "Analyzing rap lyrics using python" lightning talk ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSXaeIgQSuY)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSXaeIgQSuY 

[TEDxBKK "How Bangkok wakes up" documentary photography on what happens in Bangkok at 6,7,8 am. ](http://tedxbkk.com/speakers/2010)
http://tedxbkk.com/speakers/2010 

Barcamp Montreal "How to travel by yourself and be awesome" 

### Education:  
I have a Bachelors of Mathematics from the University of Waterloo! 
I attended Hacker School(never graduate!), NYC, in Summer 2013
